title: Ansible Documentation
summary: Learn how to use Ansible, a simple and powerful automation platform, with this comprehensive documentation. Find installation, configuration, usage, and development guides for Ansible and its modules, plugins, collections, and ecosystem.

title: Ansible (software) - Wikipedia
summary: Ansible is an open-source software suite that enables infrastructure as code for Unix-like and Windows systems. It is agentless, uses a declarative language, and supports multiple control nodes and dynamic inventory sources.

title: Getting started with Ansible
summary: Learn how to use Ansible to automate the management of remote systems and control their desired state. Find out how to install Ansible, create an inventory, write a playbook, and run Ansible commands on a control node.

title: Ansible Documentation
summary: Learn how to use Ansible, an open-source automation tool that is simple, flexible, and powerful. Find quicklinks, guides, tutorials, and resources for users, developers, and maintainers.

title: GitHub - ansible/ansible: Ansible is a radically simple IT automation ...

title: Learning Ansible basics - Red Hat
summary: Ansible® is an open source IT automation engine that automates provisioning, configuration management, application deployment, orchestration, and many other IT processes.. Ansible can be used to install software, automate daily tasks, provision infrastructure and network components, improve security and compliance, patch systems, and orchestrate complex workflows.

summary: Ansible is an open-source IT engine that automates application deployment, cloud provisioning, intra-service orchestration, and other IT tools. title: Installing Ansible — Ansible Community Documentation
summary: Installing Ansible . Ansible is an agentless automation tool that you install on a single host (referred to as the control node). From the control node, Ansible can manage an entire fleet of machines and other devices (referred to as managed nodes) remotely with SSH, Powershell remoting, and numerous other transports, all from a simple command-line interface with no databases or daemons required.

title: Using Variables — Ansible Community Documentation
summary: Transforming variables with Jinja2 filters . Jinja2 filters let you transform the value of a variable within a template expression. Jinja2 includes many built-in filters and Ansible supplies many more filters.

title: Windows Remote Management — Ansible Community Documentation
summary: Warning. Using the winrm or psrp connection plugins in Ansible on MacOS in the latest releases typically fails. This is a known problem that occurs deep within the Python stack and cannot be changed by Ansible. The only workaround today is to set the environment variable OBJC_DISABLE_INITIALIZE_FORK_SAFETY=yes, no_proxy=* and avoid using Kerberos auth.

title: Windows SSH — Ansible Community Documentation
summary: Unlike the psrp or winrm connection plugins, the SSH connection plugin cannot get a Kerberos TGT ticket when provided with an explicit username and password. This means that the user must have a valid Kerberos ticket before running the playbook. See Kerberos Authentication for more information on how to configure, use, and troubleshoot Kerberos authentication.

title: Ansible: Multiple and/or conditionals in when clause
summary: Yes, there can be only one is defined and, if I remember correctly it should be at the end. The problem is that Ansible internally always faces an exception when a variable is not defined.
